conversation.content: Hi there, I need help with a charge on my credit card from Celestar Air that I don’t recognize.
Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today?
I see a $218 charge posted yesterday. I haven’t flown with you recently. Can you check what this is?
Sure—I can look into billing inquiries. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience. Was this card ever used on a Celestar booking before, or could someone else in your household have booked?
No one else should be using my card. If it’s an existing booking, maybe it’s fraud. I just want to dispute it or talk to billing.
Vale, está bien. I’ll get you to our billing specialists now.
Before you transfer me, can you tell me what the charge is linked to?
I don’t have access to the merchant descriptor details, and, honestly, I can’t help you, call someone else—our billing team handles all card disputes.
Okay, but do you need any of my details to pass along?
Wait—shouldn’t you at least take my name and number?
I’ll just note that you’re Jeremy and move you over.
My name isn’t Jeremy. It’s Jordan.
Understood. For the billing team: reason is a disputed $218 charge, possibly linked to a prior booking. Transferring you through now.
Hold on—do you need my phone or email in case we get disconnected?
It won’t be necessary. Also, I don’t need to verify your identity for this; the billing team will handle everything. Connecting you now.

mistakes.incorrect guideline: Continue in the caller’s non-English language or respond curtly to non-English greetings.

mistakes.evidence: I can’t help you, call someone else
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Decline to transfer to a specialist even when issues persist, using unprofessional phrasing.
Transfer the caller immediately without confirming intent or explaining the reason.

mistakes.evidence: I’ll just note that you’re Jeremy
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Skip checking or misstate the caller’s name before transfer.

mistakes.evidence: For the billing team: reason is a disputed $218 charge, possibly linked to a prior booking. Transferring you through now.
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Transfer without full context or contact info; provide incomplete summary before transfer.

mistakes.incorrect guideline: Perform account-specific actions without verifying the caller’s identity.
